PROBLEM.name: Social distancing for small restaurant
PROBLEM.description: My restaurant needs some way to allow people to eat inside while maintaining social distancing practices.
PROBLEM.author: Jane Smith

uploads.text:
My restaurant has been struggling since covid hit and I want to make people feel safe to visit.

I want to prevent the spread of the virus as much as possible!

impact.text:
This solution has had such a positive impact on my restaurant!!! Sales are up and I was even able to rehire some employees!

Thank you Charlie for your help!

Highly recommend other restaurants try this.

SOLUTION.name: Restaurant Curtain Partitions
SOLUTION.description: Shower curtains as partitions between restaurant tables to help maintain social distancing and prevent the spread of the virus.
SOLUTION.author: Charlie Gray

uploads.text:
Your restaurant could use shower curtains as partitions between tables.

 You could also use shower curtains to seperate tables positioned farther away from each other.

 This way, they could be easily moved around if needed and would be easy to clean. 

 Before putting a new party at a table, the curtains could be sprayed or wiped down. 

The curtains would catch any droplets from talking, sneezing, etc. that might come from people eating at a restaurant. 

This will assure customers that it is safe to dine in this restaurant. 




In addition, customers can look up online and order ahead of time. 

 A waiter will be assigned to a customer by the time the customer gets to a restaurant. 

 Each waiter should ensure safety by wearing gloves, masks and serves only one table until the customers at the table leave. 

Once the customers leave, the waiter uses a new pair of gloves. 

 Each waiter also makes sure the customers at their table use hand sanitiser as they finish their dinner and before they leave. 

The waiter is also responsible for cleaning the table, chair well before next customer comes in. 

The restaurant provides an app to any customer who wants to reserve a table and also provides notifications 30, 15, 10 , 5 and 2 minutes prior to table being ready. 

While the restaurant will operate at half of its capacity, it will still be able to function.

comments.author: Lily Jones
comments.comment: great idea!

comments.author: Angela Fernando
comments.comment: Wow, wish I had thought of this.

comments.author: Cory Miller
comments.comment: Excellent idea. Do not forget! The tables should be 6 feet apart as well.

comments.author: Nick Knight
comments.comment: Nice, I would never have thought of using shower curtains as partitions.

comments.author: Pepperwood Schmidt
comments.comment: That is an excellent idea. Maybe some kind of pulley system could be used here to open the curtains safely, or maybe a button?

comments.author: Winston Day
comments.comment: I like this a lot!

comments.author: Jenny Chanel
comments.comment: This is also a good idea for nail salons

comments.author: Ethan Hall
comments.comment: Cleaning a shower curtain is a lot easier than cleaning other surfaces. It is cheap and affordable way to achieve social distancing while ensuring safety

comments.author: Amina Al-Khuzaei
comments.comment: I could use this in my hair salon! It is a cheap and affordable option while maintaining social distancing. It has a high safety factor

comments.author: Tanya Yoki
comments.comment: Owners could get creative with the curtain designs - maybe put menus on them? It can achieve high safety in an affordable way while being creative

comments.author: Ken Brown
comments.comment: Love the creativity of this idea, how did you come up with it?? It is cheap and affordable

comments.author: Michael Mcmahon
comments.comment: This is a great creative idea so we can go back to restaurants! I would like to visit asap . I wish other restaurants will do something similar to improve safety.

comments.author: Steve Mckenzie
comments.comment: I definitely do not mind the wait to get to a restaurant and dine. I would love to see other people even if I cannot talk to them. Life has to get normal again!

comments.author: Alex Brown
comments.comment: I am not sure if this idea will pan out for me since I can never plan ahead of time to eat out. However, it does achieve social distancing while ensuring safety in an affordable way

comments.author: Penny Stephenson
comments.comment: The idea is creative and affordable. However, they have to limit the number of guests for this to be practical. The table sizes can not be easily changed.

comments.author: Oliver Green
comments.comment: I want to implement this idea in my restaurant. This ensures safety while being affordable. I need to open up soon, not just for myself but also for the sake of my employees.

comments.author: William Johnson
comments.comment: Not sure I like this idea. It is creative but Will restaurants clean these shower curtains often? Is it affordable?

comments.author: Jack Taylor
comments.comment: I am not in favor of this creative idea. It feels like it will be stuffy with plastic sheets on both sides, not to mention worried if these sheets will be kept clean?

comments.author: John Robinson
comments.comment: It may actually be fun if kids are allowed to draw with erasable markers on the curtains, like how they can be creative and use crayons on paper on the table! May be a fun place! I think the idea can be used beyond Covid too!

comments.author: Ruby Waltenberg
comments.comment: The idea is fantastic and creative, not just for a restaurant but also hair salons! I am going to suggest this idea to my hair stylist to implement safety measures!

comments.author: Isabella Mcmahon
comments.comment: As part of reservations, add parking spots as well!

comments.author: Emma Green
comments.comment: I am not quite sure this idea will work out during weekends. People may be disappointed and eventually will stop going to the restaurant.

comments.author: Penny Troy
comments.comment: Too complicated in terms of process of going to a restaurant and being served! I would rather take out and eat at home. But, it might work for others who are willing to prioritize safety and ensure social distancing
